_meta.prompt: Extract complete artwork details including THE URL, title, year, category, full descriptions, materials, and high-res images (src_o). Return JSON.

data.title: One ritual
data.description_en:
Built on iconic clips by Guo Laoshi and Yaoshui-ge, catchphrases like “yesmola,” “mi hotel,” and “Are you worthy?” become kinetic typography—breath and beat for the screen. Through repetition, language amplifies itself, conjuring a “livestream ritual” that keeps generating. Seeing and being seen iterate between barrages and clips; the crowd touches a fleeting bond in the carnival, only to meet, in the hush after laughter, the lezi-ren’s (fun-seeker’s) alienation and hollow core—loneliness returning like an echo from noise.

“Abstract culture” names an online subculture that is anti-logic, anti-narrative, anti-authority, dissolving mainstream speech through profanity, dialect, semantic slippage, and insider jargon. Emerging from the livestream wave circa 2015 and streamer scenes like “6324,” it grows through watching, mockery, and remixes. Its pull is an instant gratification of “anti-common sense—anti-refinement—anti-logic,” feeding a watchword of entertainment-first; viewers gain a brief illusion of commonality by repetition and remix. Yet most look on as lezi-ren, consuming others’ embarrassment with spoof and cold sneer. The ties are thin, the affect low: synchronous bustle alongside deep solitude. Abstract culture offers a chorus-ready template, but struggles to form durable bonds, reflecting how “person-to-person” relations hollow out in an atomized society.
data.description_cn:
以郭老师与药水哥的标志性片段为骨架，将“耶斯莫拉”“迷hotel”“您配吗”等梗语以动态字体化作屏幕的呼吸与鼓点，让语言在复读中自我增幅，召唤出一场持续生成的“直播仪式”。看与被看在弹幕与切片之间迭代，围观者在狂欢中获得短暂连结，却在笑声散场的静默里照见“乐子人”式的疏离与空心，孤独像回声一样从喧嚣深处返场。

抽象文化可被概括为一种反逻辑、反叙事、反权威的网络亚文化，通过脏话、方言、错位语义与黑话化再生产，完成对主流话语的“消解”与“滑移”。其渊源可追溯至2015年前后的直播潮与“6324”等主播社群生态，并在围观、嘲讽、二创的循环中被持续放大。抽象内容以“反常识—反精致—反逻辑”的即时愉悦为吸力，满足“娱乐至上”的观看逻辑，观众通过复读与二创获得短暂的共同体错觉。然而，围观者多以“乐子人”心态消费“他者的出丑”，以恶搞与冷嘲构筑脆弱的连接，情感承诺极低，导致共时热闹与纵深孤独并存。抽象文化提供了可快速合唱的语言模板，却难以生成稳定的社群纽带，映照出社会原子化语境中“人—人关系”的空洞化。

data.title: Two rituals
data.description_en: Three strands are braided into a single cut: Sun Santo’s sacred tune Crying Smoke-Soul; Ag’s ritual performance of Ksitigarbha inherited from his grandmother; and everyday clips Gongze posted to his friend circle. The narrative takes its cue from Gongze’s account of peers in Harbin: drifting through club culture, turning to livestream commerce, then—amid economic shifts—entering the “chuma xian” spirit-medium system to “see/soothe,” a role akin to informal counseling. Ag threads these with a framework of Ksitigarbha devotion and an urban sensorium of “ruin—bardo.” The trajectory mirrors phases of the Simplified-Chinese internet and public discourse, charting the currents of “folk spirituality—platform economy—generational livelihood,” and placing the consolatory function of Crying Smoke-Soul in counterpoint to a social role likened to a “psychiatrist.” Ag’s method draws on a Jiangnan rite for Ksitigarbha—“inserting stick incense” into the earth—both a family lineage and a way to intervene on site. In 2016, Ag enacted it at the former “Qijia Village” in Putuo. Shanghai, in Ag’s grasp, is a “bardo/illusory city”: center and fold, underground and edge, gleam and height as a single continuum, where roles and scenes turn on the axis “ruin—bardo—vow-power.” The “temporary ruins” left by the Dinghai Bridge relocation anchor the shoot and interlock with an incense rite on Ksitigarbha’s birthday, proposing a bodily way of seeing that “finds soil’s seams in concrete.” In the post-pandemic city, driverless metros and the “ghost train” rhyme with a “headless, tailless film,” linking to a clear-eyed practice of “seeing better in the dark”—a chain of metaphors that gives the image its “bardo-in-ruins” cadence. The finished edit lays its sound bed with Crying Smoke-Soul; Ag’s ruin-body performance steers the image; and friend-circle clips puncture the surface as reality’s burrs. Folk belief, urban experience, and platformed life are made concurrent, elaborating a viewing mode and narrative in which “vow-power moves through the bardo.”
data.description_cn: 这件作品由三部分素材拼合而成：使用孙三通的神调《哭烟魂》、Ag祖传自奶奶的地藏仪轨行为视频- Ksitigarbha，以及宫泽发布于朋友圈的生活片段，最终被重新剪辑成单一的视频。其叙事线索来自宫泽讲述的东北（哈尔滨）同辈从俱乐部文化到直播带货再到转入“出马仙”式的“心理咨询/安抚”角色的转变，并由Ag以地藏信仰与“废墟—中阴（bardo）”的城市感受为精神框架将三者串联。作品的叙事线索来自宫泽对东北（哈尔滨）同辈的一段代际轨迹的讲述：从少年混迹俱乐部、进入club工作，转向直播带货，再在经济转折后进入“出马仙”体系，以“看事/安抚”的方式承担某种“心理咨询”角色。这一路径与简中互联网及社会舆论的阶段性变迁同频，呈现“民间灵性—平台经济—代际生计”的流变，并在语义上将“心理医生式”的社会角色与《哭烟魂》的劝解功能对位。Ag的行动框架来自江南关于地藏的民间供养仪轨“插棒香（插地香）”——既是家族传承，也是其介入城市现场的方法论。2016年，Ag曾在普陀“七家村”旧址公开完成相关仪式。Ag对上海的整体感知是“中阴（bardo）/幻觉之城”：将中心的褶皱、地下与边缘与高耸光鲜视为同一连续体，并以“废墟—中阴—愿力”的转换逻辑来塑造角色与场景。定海桥动迁后的“暂时性废墟”成为拍摄起点，并与地藏诞辰日完成的插香仪轨相互嵌合，指向一种“在混凝土中寻找泥土缝隙”的身体化观看方式。后疫情时期的无人驾驶地铁与“幽灵列车”意象呼应“无头无尾的电影”，与“在黑暗中看得更清”的清眼动作构成隐喻链条，支撑“中阴在废墟中”的影像语感。最终成片以《哭烟魂》铺陈声场，Ag的废墟身体表演执掌视觉叙事，朋友圈的日常影像作为现实的刺点插入。此种并置让民间信仰、当代城市经验与平台化生活同时发生，构筑出“愿力穿行中阴”的观看机制与叙事框架。
